comment.text:
I get this error when trying to install
    Error:
    Problem 1: problem with installed package php-twig2-2.13.1-1.fc32.noarch
    - package drupal8-8.9.5-1.fc32.noarch conflicts with php-composer(twig/twig) >= 2.0 provided by php-twig2-2.13.1-1.fc32.noarch
    - package drupal8-8.9.5-1.fc32.noarch conflicts with php-composer(twig/twig) >= 2.0 provided by php-twig2-2.12.5-1.fc32.noarch
    - conflicting requests
    Problem 2: problem with installed package phpMyAdmin-5.0.2-2.fc32.noarch
    - package phpMyAdmin-5.0.2-2.fc32.noarch requires (php-composer(twig/twig) >= 2.4 with php-composer(twig/twig) < 3), but none of the providers can be installed
    - package drupal8-8.9.5-1.fc32.noarch conflicts with php-composer(twig/twig) >= 2.0 provided by php-twig2-2.13.1-1.fc32.noarch
    - package drupal8-8.9.5-1.fc32.noarch conflicts with php-composer(twig/twig) >= 2.0 provided by php-twig2-2.12.5-1.fc32.noarch
    - package drupal8-httpd-8.9.5-1.fc32.noarch requires drupal8 = 8.9.5-1.fc32, but none of the providers can be installed
    - conflicting requests
    (try to add '--allowerasing' to command line to replace conflicting packages or '--skip-broken' to skip uninstallable packages)
The `drupal8` package has conflicted with Twig v2 since 8.4.6-2 (Sat Mar 31 2018) -- see https://src.fedoraproject.org/rpms/drupal8/c/2b082882a1b0c5fdce466bd32b7b41bf84235bbc

Latest upstream release: 8.9.1
Current version/release in rawhide: 8.9.0-1.fc33
URL: http://drupal.org/project/drupal

Please consult the package updates policy before you issue an update to a stable branch: https://docs.fedoraproject.org/en-US/fesco/Updates_Policy/


More information about the service that created this bug can be found at: https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Upstream_release_monitoring


Please keep in mind that with any upstream change, there may also be packaging changes that need to be made. Specifically, please remember that it is your responsibility to review the new version to ensure that the licensing is still correct and that no non-free or legally problematic items have been added upstream.

FEDORA-2020-a064e7dd38 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 32. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2020-a064e7dd38

FEDORA-2020-a064e7dd38 has been pushed to the Fedora 32 testing repository.
In short time you'll be able to install the update with the following command:
`sudo dnf upgrade --enablerepo=updates-testing --advisory=FEDORA-2020-a064e7dd38`
You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2020-a064e7dd38

See also https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for more information on how to test updates.

FEDORA-2020-eb137c7eda has been pushed to the Fedora 33 testing repository.
In short time you'll be able to install the update with the following command:
`sudo dnf upgrade --enablerepo=updates-testing --advisory=FEDORA-2020-eb137c7eda`
You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2020-eb137c7eda

See also https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for more information on how to test updates.

FEDORA-2020-a064e7dd38 has been pushed to the Fedora 32 stable repository.
If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.

FEDORA-2020-eb137c7eda has been pushed to the Fedora 33 stable repository.
If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.
